column1: Bogotol (Russian: Богото́л) is a town in Krasnoyarsk Krai
column3: located 6 kilometers (3.7 mi) of the Chulym River and 252 kilometers (157 mi) west of Krasnoyarsk
column4: the administrative center of the krai. Population: 21

column1: It was founded in 1893 due to the construction of the Trans-Siberian Railway. The name derives from the Ket words bogotu (one of the Ket tribes in the area) and ul (river). Bogotol was granted town status in 1911.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Bogotol serves as the administrative center of Bogotolsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the krai town of Bogotol—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the krai town of Bogotol is incorporated as Bogotol Urban Okrug.
